author: @sentdex
text: Since this series, Yahoo Finance has moved to using javascript to populate the tables, which requires a browser, or something acting like a browser, to parse (otherwise fields are empty). You can learn more about parsing javascript here: https://pythonprogramming.net/javascript-dynamic-scraping-parsing-beautiful-soup-tutorial/ but also a member of the community has provided an example for doing this with the Yahoo Finance API: https://github.com/tomgs/sentdexworkarounds

author: @stevezzz4592
text: Hello Harrison, Great videos, thank you very much! It seems this method not working right now, I'm able to visit the website and save as .html file. But there isnt any stats there when I open the website. Could you help me with that?

author: @SohelKhan-tr6jr
text: OS X users: if you are having issues in running the code, you may consider changing following  line from:  e = e.replace(".../intraQuarter/_KeyStats\\","") to: e = os.path.basename(os.path.normpath(e))   Hope it helps.

author: @TheMraptor
text: You could have used (at least for prices): http://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/remote_data.html#remote-data-fred

author: @sentdex
text: +Siddarth Kothiwale I don't plan on sharing the specific method I used, as it was extremely hackish and not ideal. I plan instead to make larger use of Quandl, I believe they should have all the data we seek. If not, then using an EDGAR API will be more ideal than what I've done.
